name: Ani Plaza Hotel

reviews.text: Great people. The breakfast was fine too.
reviews.title: Great people...

reviews.text: The hotel-discount at the ani website (for more than 5 days) was a value.
reviews.title: Price quality it is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed

reviews.text: August is not the best time to see the Ararat from the highest floors...Dont count on that...and you have a chance for a great surprize.
reviews.title: Good hotel with great service

reviews.text: This hotel is very well located at the city center.
reviews.title: May be worst hotel (****) where I was and never return back.

reviews.text: Upon arrival at the hotel people at the desk are very friendly and helpfull.
reviews.title: Very good hotel... but don't leave your postcards at the desk!

reviews.text: It was great. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped me plan my days in Armenia, which is a great country and I will visit it again as I do because I am so attached even though I am not Armenian. The hotel has great service and its location is good with many stores nearby. The rooms were roomy and had air conditioning
reviews.title: A Pleasure

reviews.text: I have slept for three nights. Building and interior in Sovjet style. Rooms are well maintained. Everywhere there is free WiFi. Breakfast is fine (except the crappy coffee). Also buffet (lunch and dinner) are well cared for. The staff speaks excellent English and is very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel with no frills

reviews.text: Location is also OK: ATM and supermarket nearby. Also near the city center and near good resaturants
reviews.title: reasonable price at convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for about a week. At that time, due to some huge tourist group, the hotel lobby and breakfast place were overflowing with people. That affects waiting at the elevators and search for a breakfast table. Nevertheless, the staff were good and used to promptly get food for the breakfast(it is good here). The rooms are really small but kept neat. Just across the hotel is a bank machine and nice restaurents around. The place is walking distance to the centre of the town. Hotel's airport pick up was good(at a price).
reviews.title: Soviet era remodel still dreary but well located

reviews.text: This is barely a 3 star on western standards, but given its location, it gets the 3rd. Be sure to avoid economy or standard rooms which are little more than closets with hard twin beds, holes in the wall, doors that don't fit, and a barely acceptable bathroom. Business affords larger space and some nonsmoking rooms--hotel reeks from cigarettes. The air circulation is bad, and windows don't open. No real lobby. Decent "whiskey bar." Staff is very nice.
reviews.title: Decent location

reviews.text: I am tempted to give the Ani Plaza a three-star "average" rating, but I just can't bring myself do it. Yes, it offers an adequate breakfast (but nothing special) and the cocktail lounge/cafe has a kitschy 1960s feel to it and actually has good pizza and very courteous waiters. But the main problem are the rooms - and that is the main point of a hotel: what is your room like?
reviews.title: "Average" for the former USSR = "poor"

reviews.text: The rooms are laid out in a bizarre fashion, with a main room/bathroom greeting you as you enter. But then you notice a long, long wall with an opening at the far end. You walk into this opening and look down a long, dark corridor to find your bed somewhere in the distance. And they squeeze in very wide beds, which makes maneuvering almost impossible. When you get situated for the night, you realize that the television is back at the other end - maybe eight meters away, a tiny dot at the end of a tunnel. Tunnel is the right word, because it's DARK in there!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Why they don't knock out those walls and open up some space is beyond me. And while they're at it, they might want to rip out the carpeting, which was laid down some time during the Khrushchev era.
reviews.title: UNBELIAVABLE!

reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and stay at the Hotel Meg or the Congress, which my colleagues tell me is much more up to date than the worn-out Ani Plaza.
reviews.title: Recent Business Trip

reviews.text: I've been in this hotel last week and all i can say is that the location of the hotel is perfect , the stuff is very kind, the rooms are clean and the food is excellent. The only thing that can disturb you a little is that you can hear your neighbour if he is talking loudly. In one word "qualite prix" perfect.
reviews.title: An Average Hotel

reviews.text: Very well placed in the middle of the city, behind the best restaurants and bars, with a supermarket in the corner where to change money without commission, this superb hotel is not a 5 star but could be. Professional staff, spacious rooms, large breakfast buffet and free wi fi in the rooms. So, why to pay more in an international chain?
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in the middle of Yerevan

reviews.text: I have stayed in Ani Plaza Hotel during my trip to Armenia in September 2008. I arrived really early in the morning after overnight flight and staff was helpful enough to allocate room for me for a small additional fee. I stayed 3 nights there and then extra 1 night at the end of my trip.
reviews.title: Perfect location, great breakfast, poor room

reviews.text: Hotel is located really centrally in Yerevan, actually close to all attractions and sights. It is easy to walk around, even in the evening. Lobby is elegant and reception staff is absolutely great - professional, helpful and just polite... They would help you with your travel arrangements or just answering questions, how to orientate in the city centre. There is travel agent desk, but I didn't use them - I've seen Armenia by myself.
reviews.title: Noise, noise, noise!
Good soviet-style hotel
reviews.text: My room (rooms) were single rooms as price difference for double was significant. Even now I could say, that was not small amount. Comparing to European hotels, standard and price relation wasn't the same - it was quite expensive. Room was quite small, but enough for 1 person. Clean, but dated. Linens were fresh, but room (booked as non-smoking) wasn't... I had my windows open almost all the time. There was TV with small selection of programs. Bathroom was OK, but again - nothing special. Both rooms had "some views" from the window - hm... It wasn't the best and most attractive view of Yerevan (both of them from back side of the hotel).

Breakfast was one of the best parts of my stay in Ani Plaza. Even if I had to join dozens of noisy package holiday tourists I really loved that. Absolutely huge selection of international and local dishes, drinks, fruits, pastries etc. 5+ for that. Staff (most of them really young) were quick (sometimes too quick, grabbing my coffee from the table before I brought my plate, haha), but natural and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Location, Clean and Helpful staff

description: Ani Plaza Hotel is situated right in the heart of the city, within only 15 minutes' drive from the Zvartnots International Airport, in the Business, Entertainment and Shopping center. The Hotel has 247 spacious comfortable rooms including Deluxe, Junior and Executive Suites offering a magnificent view of the Biblical Mount Ararat and a gorgeous panorama of the state of the art building of the National Opera House.
